Sentencas: (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-delta (LSCF) has been promised as a cathode material of solid oxide fuel cells at intermediate temperatures.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: Despite the many previous studies of LSCF that have been reported, the role of Co and Fe atoms in the oxygen ion conduction is still unclear.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: In this work, we aimed at presenting each valence, oxygen chemical diffusion coefficient (D-chem) and activation energy (E-a) related to Co and Fe in LSCF by in situ X-ray absorption spectroscopy (XAS) at high temperatures and during reduction.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: For quantitative analysis of X-ray absorption near edge structure (XANES) spectroscopy, these results indicated that the Co valence decreased more easily than the Fe valence.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: On the other hand, from relaxation plots of the Co and Fe valence during reduction, the values of D-chem and E-a related to Co and Fe were nearly equal.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: Considering equations showing the oxygen ion conductivity, these results would indicate that oxygen ion conductivity was contributed by Co with more oxygen vacancies rather than Fe.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ

Sentencas: According to these results, a structural model with and without oxygen vacancies and the oxygen ion conduction mechanism of LSCF was speculated, that is, we found that oxygen ion conductivity was more closely related to Co than Fe in LSCF by direct observations of in situ XAS.
Titulo: Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ
Oxygen Partial Pressure Dependence of In Situ X-Ray Absorption Spectroscopy at Co and Fe K-Edge for (La0.6Sr0.4)(Co0.2Fe0.8)O3-δ
